intro: Pseudibatia lanata, commonly known as the woolly pseudibatia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in countries like Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive, woolly appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Pseudibatia lanata is often found in rocky or arid environments, where it adapts well to harsh climatic conditions.
